intro: Thyrsanthus adenobasis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thyrsin, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and compact inflorescences. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
